page.title: 06Recreation: Les Mielles
page.content: This area is part of the{Les Mielles {coastal park}and as such the activities that take place here are carefully monitored. The so-called Five Mile Road immediately behind the beach is the longest stretch of isolated, straight road in the island. It is used for{running, {road racing}and by garages to{test car {brakes}etc. It is a great temptation fo people to break the island speed limit of 40 mph. There are several car parks in the grassy area between the road and the cliffs which is used for{picknicking. {There are also bridle}paths for horse riding, a{driving range}(golf) range,{9 hole golf course, putting {course}and{driving range.}A careful balance is being maintained all the time between preserving the environment and recreational uses.
